elements.name: notifyPGTDownloadExplanation
elements.title:
Because your application involves a child under the age of 19 or an adult who is not `mentally competent`, you will need to let the Public Guardian and Trustee (PGT) know that you are applying for a `Representation Grant`.

The PGT will review to ensure the children and adults who are not mentally competent will be treated fairly. The legislated fee for the PGT's review is $315.00.

For more information, click here to read about the PGT's role in your application. (This link opens in a new tab)

You will need to give the PGT:
  • a Form P1
  • a letter to explain your application
  • a cheque or bank draft for $315.00 payable to "Public Guardian and Trustee"
This service will now create the letter that you need.
elements.description: [when read-only-answers get enabled] Next, download Form P1.

elements.name: notifyDownloadPGTFAQ1
elements.title: How do I use a PDF?
elements.body:
A PDF stands for Portable Document Format. It is a type of file that can be saved onto your computer. To open the PDF, you may need Adobe Reader (free to download) or other similar software.

Click here to down Adobe Reader for free. (This link opens in a new tab)
